english: bathe; to take a bath; to wash; to immerse

etymology.interpretation: Water element signals a liquid-related action, while 谷 contributes the sound, aligning with historical -uk/-ok rimes. Together they point to washing or immersing the body in water.

examples.chinese: 我们在温泉里沐浴(我們在溫泉裡沐浴)。
examples.english: We bathe in the hot springs.

examples.chinese: 他走进浴室准备洗澡(他走進浴室準備洗澡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒu jìn yùshì zhǔnbèi xǐzǎo.
examples.english: He walks into the bathroom to get ready to bathe.

examples.chinese: 我更喜欢淋浴而不是泡澡(我更喜歡淋浴而不是泡澡)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ gèng xǐhuan línyù ér bú shì pào zǎo.
examples.english: I prefer taking a shower rather than a soak.
